statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Weber St. 73, Portland St. 68
article.story: OGDEN, Utah (AP) -- Daviin Davis scored a career-high 23 points and Dezmon Harris added 13 as Weber State beat Portland State 73-68 on Thursday night. Harris scored five straight points for the Wildcats (6-8, 1-1 Big Sky), giving Weber State a 67-62 lead with 1:42 left in the game. Davis scored the next six and the Wildcats hung on for the win. Andre Murray led the Vikings (9-8, 2-2) with 13 points while Julius Thomas had 12. Juan Pablo Silveira's 3-pointer with about 10 minutes left in the game gave the Wildcats a 54-43 lead, their biggest advantage of the game. The Vikings came back with an 11-1 run and later took a 62-61 lead on Jeremiah Dominguez's 3-pointer with 3:31 remaining. Steve Panos, who scored 11, tied it again with a free throw and Harris put the Wildcats up for good with five straight points. Weber State missed its first six shots and trailed 9-0 early in the game, however the Wildcats scored the next 11 points with Arturas Valeika capping off the run with a dunk. The officials whistled Valeika for hanging on the rim too long and Portland State's Kyle Coston hit both free throws to tie the game. Neither team led by more than three points for the rest of the half until WSU ended the stanza on an 8-0 run to lead 34-29 at the break.
